intro: Draba malpighiacea, commonly known as the Malpighiaceae dwarf cabbage, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its small, basal rosette of leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, it thrives in rocky and alpine environments. The plant produces small, rounded fruits called siliques, which contain several seeds. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ability to withstand cold climates.
